tags: have you noticed that i always write these things from tonys perspective bc i actually cant write steve
summary:
tony's had many a new year's kiss, some drunk and some sober.
but none of them were like this.
because he's holding onto steve's...
body:
tony’s had many a new year’s kiss, some drunk and some sober.

but none of them were like this.

because he’s holding onto steve’s shirt and his boyfriend is smiling down at him and he feels warm inside, and not from the champagne he had earlier.

he’s soft and safe and comfortable.

he’s home.

tony spends the beginning of the year kisisng steve, and he thinks he’d like to spend all the new years to come that way, too.

blog.title: still working on believing
blog.description: jordan | writer | stevetony | ace | anti-st*rker

summary: do y’all ever wonder how calculating tony must be? like not in the cold emotionless way, but the math he must do on a general...
body:
do y’all ever wonder how calculating tony must be? like not in the cold emotionless way, but the math he must do on a general basis? someone could swing a yo-yo and he’d probably be able to tell you it’s period and tension of the string

like he looks at things and calculates. he made peter’s suit to fit perfectly to him, and he didn’t even MEET him. he watched youtube videos and calculated his mass, his weight distribution, his physics, his internal sense of gravity and space. youtube videos. 

he looks at people and calculates. he could probably tell you the exact parabolic function for the shape of your nose. either way he’s a genius genius and i love him

tags: you guys are sending in some interesting headcan people
summary: I think you know I want to know what you think Tony Stark smells of.
question: I think you know I want to know what you think Tony Stark smells of.
answer:
GREAT NEWS my computer decided to force a restart on me just after I’d finished typing this up but before I’d posted it.  So here it is again, a day late.

  • What they smell like: something expensive but tasteful.  Spicy, with mineral undertones of that dry dusty dirt your skin smells like when you’ve been outside too long in the summer sun, and a comforting metallic overtone you get when you’ve been tinkering with tech too long.
  • How they sleep (sleeping position, schedule, etc): off-schedule, and either face-first over his workbench or with his arms and legs wrapped around his sweetheart, like a baby sloth.
  • What music they enjoy: Sabbath, Floyd, Zeppelin, Queen.  Maybe Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs?
  • How much time they spend getting ready every morning: it’s either a bespoke pre-cleanse/cleanse/tone/serum/moisturise routine, or a splash of cold water over his face and a generous dab of Total De-Stress aromatherapy blend on the temples.
  • Their favorite thing to collect: this is somewhat of a non-sequitur but why has Tony never attempted to build a freaking VOLTRON (though lbr he prefers to refer to it by the original Japanese name, Beast King Go Lion because Voltron sounds too much like Ultron and that’s still pretty raw) with like robot suits for all his friends that come together into a GIANT ROBOT SUIT THAT DOES FIGHTING THE BAD GUYS
  • Left or right-handed: Apparently he gets his left arm hurt a lot, so hopefully right handed.
  • Religion (if any): it’s unlikely
  • Favorite sport: does Robot Wars count
  • Favorite touristy thing to do when traveling (museums, local food, sightseeing, etc): reservations at the nearest restaurant with at least one Michelin star, and secretly the kind of selfies you take in front of a famous landmark but your faces take up enough of the frame you can’t see the landmark anyway
  • Favorite kind of weather: it’s spring and the sun’s out and it’s not too sweaty for a suit, flowers are in bloom.  A nice day for a picnic in the park, or doing yoga on the roof.
  • A weird/obscure fear they have: SHUT UP NO.  I AM SAD THINKING ABOUT THE THINGS HE’S SCARED OF :’(
  • The carnival/arcade game they always win without fail: I mean he could figure out exactly how to hack the claw grabby machine to get the dumb stuffed animal his date thinks is cute, but he also has the wherewithal to just order one and have it sent to them with same day delivery.

Send me more characters for weird headcanons?

blog.name: zajelimilogin
blog.title: Dream a little bigger, darling.
blog.description:
Woman.
Determined.
Braided.

What else?
Normality is overrated.
Wibbly wobbly, timey wimey.
Black, two sugars. I'll be upstairs.
One more miracle, please.

You mustn't be afraid to dream a little bigger, darling.

summary: A Black Wind Took You Away
title: A Black Wind Took You Away
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2CIAUAg

by Heartshade

AU where Loki survives when Thanos ‘killed’ him, but is taken by the snap, leaving Tony mourning him as well as Peter. Tony and Loki have been together since Loki took over Asgard after the Dark World, and have kept their relationship secret from everyone but their family (Peter, Rhodey, Pepper and Happy). Loki uses magic to escape Thanos, but when the snap happens Loki is killed as well.
Title taken from Valentine’s Day by Linkin Park
I was listening to this song and I immediately thought of Infinity War, and I just had to write this. It’s my first fic, so, sorry if it’s awful!

summary: The World is So Big (Through my Tiny Eyes)
title: The World is So Big (Through my Tiny Eyes)
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2F2xPxo

by MercyMae

“Wow! Its so different here!” Peter exclaimed to the man, but it was more of a squeak to Scott.

Scott chuckled, “Yep! Welcome to my small world, buddy.”

“Literally,” He breathed out.

“Alright, lets get you back to normal so you can go home.” He straightened and letting his back make some crackling noises.

Peter nodded and turned the button before smacking it, but it did nothing. He turned it again and pressed it more lightly. Nothing.

“Um, Scott? Its not working?”
-
A Test gone wrong and Peter is stuck being Tiny. Luckily, Mister Stark is always there to help.

blog.name: marvelousspider
blog.title: marvel
blog.description:
Master List

I write mostly irondad, send in prompts !!

body:
fever:

whump prompt 8

peter let out a low grunt as he scaled the side of his apartment, creeping to his bedroom window.

“peter are you sure you don’t want me to contact mr. stark?” karen asked for the third time, and if peter wasn’t mistaken she sounded disapproving.

“yes I’m sure,” peter insisted as he lowered himself through the window, “I don’t want to bother him.”

“he told you to contact him any time you got severely injured,” karen reminded him, “I doubt this would bother him.”

peter groaned, “karen I’m fine. this isn’t severe - it’s just a cut. besides, remember last time you insisted we call him and by the time he arrived it already was healed? I don’t want to repeat that. he still doesn’t shut up about me waking him up at 2 in the morning.”

it was true, tony groused about it every time peter nagged him about his lack of sleep - (“last time I tried to get a good night of sleep you woke me up for a scratch, kid.”)

peter knew tony was just deflecting so peter wouldn’t mention his insomnia anymore. if he knew peter was actually injured he would definitely insist peter report to him, but peter still felt bad.

karen sounded exasperated, “you know he’d want you to report this. my scans are telling me that your cut has a high probability of getting infected.”

peter winced, that was exactly what he was afraid of - the knife that had cut him had been rusty. still, he reflected, checking the shallow wound, it didn’t look bad, and it definitely didn’t look worth calling mr. stark about.

“I’m fine,” he said with finality, pulling off his mask before karen could retort. he felt kind of bad about it but he had an ap chem midterm to prepare for and making a big deal out of the injury would cut down on his study time. he would just bandage it before bed.

after about an hour peter was reasonably confident in his chemistry knowledge, and so he put away his books and prepared for bed, slipping into the bathroom to bandage the cut.

he shouldn’t have gotten it at all but he’d been being careless during a mugging. he’d totally forgot to check the man for other weapons after disarming him of his gun and webbing him up. luckily his spider sense had whirled with warning and allowed him time to dodge the knife attack, preventing anything life threatening, but it had still grazed him.

he checked the cut as he put on the bandage - it was just a shallow flesh wound, cut along his side but the skin around it looked red and inflamed, and intense heat seemed to radiate from it.

peter dismissed it uneasily, reasoning that if there was really something wrong his spidey sense would tell him.

still, he felt weirdly heavy and tired as he tunneled under the covers and his cut pulsed painfully. he drifted off into an uncomfortable sleep, pestered by nightmares of fire curling up his side.

—

he woke up late, groggy and strangely exhausted despite his relatively long night of sleep. his joints ached, and when he stood his whole body protested, his muscles tight and sore.

he almost collapsed back into bed before remembering his chemistry midterm. he glanced at his watch - he was already 10 minutes late. crap.

he threw on pants and a midtown sweater and practically tumbled out the door, throwing a hasty good bye to may as he went. he’d meant to check the bandage in the morning but in his rush he forgot.

he ran practically the whole way to school and, despite his abilities, he was sweaty and out of breath when he finally arrived. the bell rang just as he collapsed into the desk beside ned, and his teacher gave him an unimpressed look.

“nice of you to join us mr. parker.”

peter just managed a weak smile back.

“dude, what’s up with you?” ned asked in a whisper, appraising his disheveled look and flushed cheeks as their teacher went over the instructions for the test.

“I just woke up late and had to run to make it here,” peter panted.

“usually you could run a marathon without breaking a sweat,” ned pointed out.

peter just shot him a look, turning back to the front of the room. but, after ned pointed it out, he realized he was right - peter hadn’t been this out of breath since before the bite, and that was including all his patrols and training with tony. those training sessions could get intense.

his side pulsed painfully as if as a reminder and peter let out a grunt. shoot, he’d totally forgotten about that.

ned looked over at him, concerned, but the tests were being distributed and peter didn’t want to get him in trouble so he just shook his head.

I’m fine, he mouthed.

ned looked doubtful but turned to the test anyways.

peter’s side was burning so badly he could hardly concentrate on the test - he had to focus all his energy on not groaning aloud with pain. he held it in - if he made some kind of weird noise in the silent classroom he would never live it down.

worse still, peter was beginning to feel as if he was enveloped in a foggy haze. his head was unbearably heavy and it required strength to simply keep himself upright. heat was radiating from his skin, no longer just concentrated by his wound, and he realized that he probably had a very high fever. he forced himself to concentrate.

he went through the test as quickly as possible, barely reading as he circled answers and flipped through the pages. usually peter liked to take his time with each question and then go back to check but he didn’t have the energy. as soon as he finished he slumped across his desk.

he felt flash glare at him from across the room and knew that if he looked up he’d probably mouth show off or something, but peter couldn’t be bothered.

his throat felt dry and suddenly he was so cold he was shivering violently. he needed another jacket or something but he couldn’t force himself to move. the lights were too bright and his head was pounding, so he clenched his eyes closed tightly. he felt like he was experiencing a sensory overload but that wasn’t quite right. it was something else.

ned was whispering beside him, his voice high with concern but peter couldn’t bother to make it out.

he vaguely thought, this isn’t right, before slipping into unconsciousness.

the vulture was swooping at him, claws outstretched and a grin curling across his face. peter knew he couldn’t escape. he tried to run but his feet wouldn’t move.

everything was too bright, too loud. he was convulsing, his body jerking without his control.

the claws dug into him, pressing him down and he couldn’t breathe. suddenly the claws were bricks and he was trapped beneath the wreckage of a fallen building, buried alive. he called out but no one heard him, no one was listening.

his classmates were there, staring, as he yelled out. too many people were touching him. he tried to focus beyond the bright lights and he saw ned kneeling next to him crying. mj stood back, her face tight with concern. he tried to tell them he was fine but he couldn’t speak.

his desperate yells changed into a single piercing sound, a gun discharging. he ran forward as ben fell but he couldn’t catch him. he slipped on the blood and it was everywhere, over everything.

there was another voice, sharp, commanding. the yelling and touching stopped. peter could’ve smiled with relief but he was still so tired. someone else was touching him, carrying him. but he didn’t feel overwhelmed anymore, he felt safe.

his uncle smiled at him and peter knew he was going to tell him it was okay, but it wasn’t. it wasn’t at all. peter couldn’t save him. but when ben spoke the voice wasn’t his.

“hold on kid.”

ben’s face swam in front of him, set into a grim look of determination. distantly peter knew this wasn’t how ben looked when he died. he had looked more calm, more soft, more tired. he had accepted his fate, and held peter’s hand the whole time. he didn’t look this steely - there was nothing left to fight.

“ben?” peter asked softly.

ben froze, looking down at him.

“pete.” his voice was low, he sounded almost scared. he didn’t sound quite right, but that was okay. he was still warm, familiar.

“I’m sorry,” peter whispered hoarsely, tears burning his vision, “I couldn’t save you.”

when ben looked at him, he seemed pained.

“no peter. it wasn’t your fault, okay?” his voice was so sad, “it’s okay.”

it’s okay.

that was exactly what ben had said the first time. he still forgave him. peter felt relief bloom inside of him. it was okay.

“okay.”

he felt himself sink against ben, letting himself be comforted. ben was still talking but peter couldn’t hear, and as he drifted off he saw ben’s features begin to twist and distort, melting away.

like it was all a dream.

—

peter woke up in the all too familiar medbay of stark towers. he tried to remember how he got there but he was too tired. he felt weirdly nostalgic and sad.

tony was in a chair beside his bed. he didn’t seem to notice peter was awake yet.

“mr. stark?”

tony gave a slight jump, before turning to peter and giving him a smile, “pete? finally, I’ve been waiting all day. I thought you would never wake up.”

despite his light words, he seemed sad.

“what happened?” peter struggled to remember, “I had a chemistry test and then I don’t know.”

“well first of all, from now on karen’s alerting me of all your injuries, no matter what,” tony said sternly, “then I’ll decide if they’re bad enough for you to come in. no arguments.”

peter didn’t even try. he was finally starting to piece everything, remembering his cut, “ohhh.”

he looked down pulling up his shirt to look at his side. there was a fresh bandage.

tony was still watching him, “long story short is that your cut got infected, and your spidey healing made it way worse. you went to school with 106.3 fever, which would’ve killed any normal human by the way. you passed out and had a seizure after your chemistry test.”

he was struggling to keep his anger out of his voice, “peter you’re literally a child genius, can you tell me why you couldn’t miss one chemistry test?”

peter flushed, and then just gave a shrug, “I don’t know.”

tony sighed, exasperated, “you’re going to be the death of me kid.”

when he saw peter still looking down, he amended in a softer voice, “just report injuries and don’t stretch yourself kid.”

peter nodded, “okay.”

“anyways,” tony continued, “your friend ned noticed the cut on your side and called me, which was good because normal paramedics wouldn’t know what to do with your accelerated healing. I flew over and took you with me and then my people helped you. that’s basically it.”

tony was avoiding his eyes. peter still felt like he was missing something. he had a sense that mr. stark was avoiding telling him something.

he also had a memory tugging at the edge of his mind, like he had experienced something amazing but now it was gone.

“that’s it?” he persisted.

tony sighed before continuing, “peter when I was carrying you out, you were all delirious with fever dreams and hallucinating or whatever.”

he paused, “you called me ben.”

“oh.”

“and you apologized for not being able to save him.”

peter’s eyes were burning, now that tony was telling him he could vaguely remember it. looking up at ben again had felt like a miracle.

“peter, look at me.”

peter looked up reluctantly, tears rimming his eyes. tony seemed impossibly sad, and he was looking directly into his eyes. peter hastily wiped away the tears.

“it wasn’t your fault,” tony said gently, “I know what it’s like to blame yourself for senseless tragedies, to feel responsible. believe me, I know.”

peter didn’t question it, tony held his guilt in the lines of his face, the weariness in his eyes, the greying of his hair. he held his guilt deep in his soul and it showed all over him.

“I promise you what happened to ben wasn’t your fault peter. I saw the footage. there was nothing you could’ve done, okay?”

peter didn’t even try to hide the tears streaming down his face. he nodded, and managed to choke out, “okay.”

then tony did something unusual, he reached across the bed and pulled peter into a hug. peter returned it, grasping him like he was the only thing left in the world. he smelled like musk and grease, and he felt strong and steady. safe.

peter couldn’t even bother being embarrassed, he was too drained, too relieved.

“tony?” he said pulling back, deciding to say it before he chickened out, “I don’t think it was like a random accident that I called you ben.”

tony looked at him, bidding him on and he continued, “you remind me of him a little. I don’t know you both make me feel safe I guess.”

he was blushing but tony seemed to understand. his eyes looked like they were glistening a little but peter couldn’t tell for sure.

“thanks peter.” there was a lot hidden in those two little words.

“you really carried me out in front of everyone?” peter asked, changing the subject. tony nodded with a laugh and peter let out a horrified groan.

tony grinned, “I helped your street cred kid, why are you complaining? by the way, ned texted you - you got 100 on the test. good job, kid-genius.”

his eyes were sparkling and peter could detect something a little like pride, and maybe something else too.

“thanks mr. stark.”

peter’s side was burning so badly he could hardly concentrate on the test - he had to focus all his energy on not groaning aloud with pain. he held it in - if he made some kind of weird noise in the silent classroom he would never live it down.

worse still, peter was beginning to feel as if he was enveloped in a foggy haze. his head was unbearably heavy and it required strength to simply keep himself upright. heat was radiating from his skin, no longer just concentrated by his wound, and he realized that he probably had a very high fever. he forced himself to concentrate.

he went through the test as quickly as possible, barely reading as he circled answers and flipped through the pages. usually peter liked to take his time with each question and then go back to check but he didn’t have the energy. as soon as he finished he slumped across his desk.

he felt flash glare at him from across the room and knew that if he looked up he’d probably mouth show off or something, but peter couldn’t be bothered.

his throat felt dry and suddenly he was so cold he was shivering violently. he needed another jacket or something but he couldn’t force himself to move. the lights were too bright and his head was pounding, so he clenched his eyes closed tightly. he felt like he was experiencing a sensory overload but that wasn’t quite right. it was something else.

ned was whispering beside him, his voice high with concern but peter couldn’t bother to make it out.

he vaguely thought, this isn’t right, before slipping into unconsciousness.

the vulture was swooping at him, claws outstretched and a grin curling across his face. peter knew he couldn’t escape. he tried to run but his feet wouldn’t move.

everything was too bright, too loud. he was convulsing, his body jerking without his control.

the claws dug into him, pressing him down and he couldn’t breathe. suddenly the claws were bricks and he was trapped beneath the wreckage of a fallen building, buried alive. he called out but no one heard him, no one was listening.

his classmates were there, staring, as he yelled out. too many people were touching him. he tried to focus beyond the bright lights and he saw ned kneeling next to him crying. mj stood back, her face tight with concern. he tried to tell them he was fine but he couldn’t speak.

his desperate yells changed into a single piercing sound, a gun discharging. he ran forward as ben fell but he couldn’t catch him. he slipped on the blood and it was everywhere, over everything.

there was another voice, sharp, commanding. the yelling and touching stopped. peter could’ve smiled with relief but he was still so tired. someone else was touching him, carrying him. but he didn’t feel overwhelmed anymore, he felt safe.

his uncle smiled at him and peter knew he was going to tell him it was okay, but it wasn’t. it wasn’t at all. peter couldn’t save him. but when ben spoke the voice wasn’t his.

“hold on kid.”

ben’s face swam in front of him, set into a grim look of determination. distantly peter knew this wasn’t how ben looked when he died. he had looked more calm, more soft, more tired. he had accepted his fate, and held peter’s hand the whole time. he didn’t look this steely - there was nothing left to fight.

“ben?” peter asked softly.

ben froze, looking down at him.

“pete.” his voice was low, he sounded almost scared. he didn’t sound quite right, but that was okay. he was still warm, familiar.

“I’m sorry,” peter whispered hoarsely, tears burning his vision, “I couldn’t save you.”

when ben looked at him, he seemed pained.

“no peter. it wasn’t your fault, okay?” his voice was so sad, “it’s okay.”

it’s okay.

that was exactly what ben had said the first time. he still forgave him. peter felt relief bloom inside of him. it was okay.

“okay.”

he felt himself sink against ben, letting himself be comforted. ben was still talking but peter couldn’t hear, and as he drifted off he saw ben’s features begin to twist and distort, melting away.

like it was all a dream.

—

peter woke up in the all too familiar medbay of stark towers. he tried to remember how he got there but he was too tired. he felt weirdly nostalgic and sad.

tony was in a chair beside his bed. he didn’t seem to notice peter was awake yet.

“mr. stark?”

tony gave a slight jump, before turning to peter and giving him a smile, “pete? finally, I’ve been waiting all day. I thought you would never wake up.”

despite his light words, he seemed sad.

“what happened?” peter struggled to remember, “I had a chemistry test and then I don’t know.”

“well first of all, from now on karen’s alerting me of all your injuries, no matter what,” tony said sternly, “then I’ll decide if they’re bad enough for you to come in. no arguments.”

peter didn’t even try. he was finally starting to piece everything, remembering his cut, “ohhh.”

he looked down pulling up his shirt to look at his side. there was a fresh bandage.

tony was still watching him, “long story short is that your cut got infected, and your spidey healing made it way worse. you went to school with 106.3 fever, which would’ve killed any normal human by the way. you passed out and had a seizure after your chemistry test.”

he was struggling to keep his anger out of his voice, “peter you’re literally a child genius, can you tell me why you couldn’t miss one chemistry test?”

peter flushed, and then just gave a shrug, “I don’t know.”

tony sighed, exasperated, “you’re going to be the death of me kid.”

when he saw peter still looking down, he amended in a softer voice, “just report injuries and don’t stretch yourself kid.”

peter nodded, “okay.”

“anyways,” tony continued, “your friend ned noticed the cut on your side and called me, which was good because normal paramedics wouldn’t know what to do with your accelerated healing. I flew over and took you with me and then my people helped you. that’s basically it.”

tony was avoiding his eyes. peter still felt like he was missing something. he had a sense that mr. stark was avoiding telling him something.

he also had a memory tugging at the edge of his mind, like he had experienced something amazing but now it was gone.

“that’s it?” he persisted.

tony sighed before continuing, “peter when I was carrying you out, you were all delirious with fever dreams and hallucinating or whatever.”

he paused, “you called me ben.”

“oh.”

“and you apologized for not being able to save him.”

peter’s eyes were burning, now that tony was telling him he could vaguely remember it. looking up at ben again had felt like a miracle.

“peter, look at me.”

peter looked up reluctantly, tears rimming his eyes. tony seemed impossibly sad, and he was looking directly into his eyes. peter hastily wiped away the tears.

“it wasn’t your fault,” tony said gently, “I know what it’s like to blame yourself for senseless tragedies, to feel responsible. believe me, I know.”

peter didn’t question it, tony held his guilt in the lines of his face, the weariness in his eyes, the greying of his hair. he held his guilt deep in his soul and it showed all over him.

“I promise you what happened to ben wasn’t your fault peter. I saw the footage. there was nothing you could’ve done, okay?”

peter didn’t even try to hide the tears streaming down his face. he nodded, and managed to choke out, “okay.”

then tony did something unusual, he reached across the bed and pulled peter into a hug. peter returned it, grasping him like he was the only thing left in the world. he smelled like musk and grease, and he felt strong and steady. safe.

peter couldn’t even bother being embarrassed, he was too drained, too relieved.

“tony?” he said pulling back, deciding to say it before he chickened out, “I don’t think it was like a random accident that I called you ben.”

tony looked at him, bidding him on and he continued, “you remind me of him a little. I don’t know you both make me feel safe I guess.”

he was blushing but tony seemed to understand. his eyes looked like they were glistening a little but peter couldn’t tell for sure.

“thanks peter.” there was a lot hidden in those two little words.

“you really carried me out in front of everyone?” peter asked, changing the subject. tony nodded with a laugh and peter let out a horrified groan.

tony grinned, “I helped your street cred kid, why are you complaining? by the way, ned texted you - you got 100 on the test. good job, kid-genius.”

his eyes were sparkling and peter could detect something a little like pride, and maybe something else too.

“thanks mr. stark.”

peter flushed, and then just gave a shrug, “I don’t know.”

tony sighed, exasperated, “you’re going to be the death of me kid.”

when he saw peter still looking down, he amended in a softer voice, “just report injuries and don’t stretch yourself kid.”

peter nodded, “okay.”

“anyways,” tony continued, “your friend ned noticed the cut on your side and called me, which was good because normal paramedics wouldn’t know what to do with your accelerated healing. I flew over and took you with me and then my people helped you. that’s basically it.”

tony was avoiding his eyes. peter still felt like he was missing something. he had a sense that mr. stark was avoiding telling him something.

he also had a memory tugging at the edge of his mind, like he had experienced something amazing but now it was gone.

“that’s it?” he persisted.

tony sighed before continuing, “peter when I was carrying you out, you were all delirious with fever dreams and hallucinating or whatever.”

he paused, “you called me ben.”

“oh.”

“and you apologized for not being able to save him.”

peter’s eyes were burning, now that tony was telling him he could vaguely remember it. looking up at ben again had felt like a miracle.

“peter, look at me.”

peter looked up reluctantly, tears rimming his eyes. tony seemed impossibly sad, and he was looking directly into his eyes. peter hastily wiped away the tears.

“it wasn’t your fault,” tony said gently, “I know what it’s like to blame yourself for senseless tragedies, to feel responsible. believe me, I know.”

peter didn’t question it, tony held his guilt in the lines of his face, the weariness in his eyes, the greying of his hair. he held his guilt deep in his soul and it showed all over him.

“I promise you what happened to ben wasn’t your fault peter. I saw the footage. there was nothing you could’ve done, okay?”

peter didn’t even try to hide the tears streaming down his face. he nodded, and managed to choke out, “okay.”

then tony did something unusual, he reached across the bed and pulled peter into a hug. peter returned it, grasping him like he was the only thing left in the world. he smelled like musk and grease, and he felt strong and steady. safe.

peter couldn’t even bother being embarrassed, he was too drained, too relieved.

“tony?” he said pulling back, deciding to say it before he chickened out, “I don’t think it was like a random accident that I called you ben.”

tony looked at him, bidding him on and he continued, “you remind me of him a little. I don’t know you both make me feel safe I guess.”

he was blushing but tony seemed to understand. his eyes looked like they were glistening a little but peter couldn’t tell for sure.

“thanks peter.” there was a lot hidden in those two little words.

“you really carried me out in front of everyone?” peter asked, changing the subject. tony nodded with a laugh and peter let out a horrified groan.

tony grinned, “I helped your street cred kid, why are you complaining? by the way, ned texted you - you got 100 on the test. good job, kid-genius.”

his eyes were sparkling and peter could detect something a little like pride, and maybe something else too.

“thanks mr. stark.”

summary: *swings by like Tarzan in the wild* How about a chef and a food critic AU feat. IronStrange?
question: *swings by like Tarzan in the wild* How about a chef and a food critic AU feat. IronStrange?
answer:
1. Tony owns this restaurant, called The Iron Man. It’s high-end, of course, has several stars. And Tony himself is the chef cook. He is good and he knows it and it plays into his public persona of being arrogant about his success. Stephen is a food critic and Tony is a thorn in his side. That’s why he decides to pay a visit to The Iron Man. He is very much aware of his own influence and his scathing reviews which label him as the toughest cookie in the business.

2. The problem with two egos of this size is, that they will clash sooner or later. Not in a big boom, but through thinly veiled insults, dealt with calm smiles. Pepper informs Tony immediately about Stephen’s presence in his restaurant and Tony makes sure to bring him his order himself. (’Ah, Mr. Stark, gracing me with your presence? What an honour.’—’Well, need to make sure that my biggest fan gets the best service.’)

3. Stephen was prepared to find the smallest thing that’s wrong with Tony’s cooking to rip him apart. It would bring him great pleasure to bring the Iron Cook to his knees. But he just can’t seem to find any fault in his order, everything tastes exquisite. He would never admit to it, but it somehow tastes like home.

4. Out of his depth he marches into the kitchen, only to be greeted by a brightly smiling Tony Stark. (’Now, usually our guests stay out of the kitchen, but I’ll make an exception for you, Mr. Strange. Let me show you around!’) Stephen is seething, but he masks his fury and nods, swallowing every response he has to Tony’s shit-eating grin. Tony relishes in bringing the Gourmet Wizard to his knees, as Stephen has always found something that wasn’t to his liking.

5. In the end Stephen begrudgingly admits that Tony’s food is the best he has ever tasted, including his mother’s. His critique shows it and Tony is pleased by the result. So pleased that he does everything to get into contact with Stephen again. (’This time I will cook just for you. How about 7 p.m. on Friday at my apartment?’—’… Fine. But only if you make that fantastic asparagus cream soup.’)
